category: Historical Monument / UNESCO World Heritage Site
timings: Opens 30 minutes before sunrise — closes 30 minutes before sunset; closed on Fridays
nearest_bus: Idgah Bus Stand / Agra ISBT (approx. 6–8 km)
accessibility: Well-paved paths; wheelchair access at some entrances
guided_tours: Local guides available (Hindi/English); audio guide and official counter
parking: Paid parking available near the complex
nearby_amenities: Hotels, restaurants, souvenir markets, restrooms, info counters in Agra
special_notes: One of the New Seven Wonders and UNESCO WHS; prebook tickets.

nearest_bus: Idgah Bus Stand / Agra ISBT (approx. 5–7 km)
accessibility: Large complex with uneven pathways; partial wheelchair access
guided_tours: Local guides available (Hindi/English); ASI info boards
parking: Nearby paid parking at approaches
special_notes: Huge red-sandstone fort with palaces and mosques; offers good Taj views.

accessibility: Large stone courtyards and steps; not fully wheelchair-friendly
guided_tours: Local guides available; audio guide options via private operators
parking: Public parking near the complex; nominal charges
nearby_amenities: Local eateries, guides, small shops; Agra has full services
special_notes: Once the Mughal capital under Akbar — Buland Darwaza is iconic.

accessibility: Small gardens with pathways; mixed accessibility
guided_tours: Local guides available
parking: Street/public parking nearby
special_notes: Fine pietra dura work — often called Baby Taj.

timings: Ghats are public 24/7; Ganga Aarti usually at sunset
entry_fee: No entry fee for ghats; boat rides charged separately
nearest_bus: Varanasi City Bus Stands / ISBT (approx. 3–6 km)
nearest_airport: Lal Bahadur Shastri International Airport (Varanasi) (approx. 24 km)
accessibility: Many ghats have steps; limited wheelchair access
guided_tours: Plenty of local guides offering tours in Hindi/English and boat tours
parking: Limited near older parts; paid parking at some ghats/roads
nearby_amenities: Temples, guesthouses, hotels, eateries, tea stalls, boatmen services, shops
special_notes: Varanasi is one of the world's oldest living cities; evening Ganga Aarti is a major cultural spectacle.

timings: Varies (typically early morning to late evening)
entry_fee: No general entry fee; special services may have charges
nearest_airport: Lal Bahadur Shastri International Airport (approx. 24–25 km)
accessibility: Narrow lanes; not easily wheelchair-friendly
guided_tours: Priests and guides available; language support varies
parking: Very limited in old city area; use distant parking
nearby_amenities: Pilgrim lodging, eateries, shops for religious items
special_notes: One of the holiest Shiva temples; new corridor development.

nearest_airport: Lal Bahadur Shastri International Airport (approx. 28–30 km)
accessibility: Well-kept park and museum areas; moderate accessibility
guided_tours: Local guides and audio guides available; Buddhist tour groups common
parking: Parking available near the site
special_notes: Site of Buddha’s first sermon — major for Buddhist pilgrims.

nearest_airport: Lal Bahadur Shastri International Airport (approx. 30 km)
accessibility: Riverbank access, some stairs inside fort; partial accessibility
guided_tours: Local guides available
parking: Nearby parking on approach roads
special_notes: Museum houses vintage cars and royal memorabilia.

entry_fee: Small entry fee for monument / guided access
nearest_airport: Chaudhary Charan Singh International Airport, Lucknow (approx. 20 km)
accessibility: Large courtyards but inner labyrinth involves stairs; partial wheelchair access
guided_tours: Local guides available in Hindi/English
parking: Nearby paid parking; auto/rickshaw access common
special_notes: Famous Bhul Bhulaiya (labyrinth) and Asafi Mosque; major Lucknow attraction.

nearest_airport: Chaudhary Charan Singh International Airport (approx. 20 km)
accessibility: Situated in busy city area; nearby pavements; outer area accessible
guided_tours: City walking tours include Rumi Darwaza
parking: Street parking / paid lots nearby
special_notes: Iconic gateway built under Nawab Asaf-ud-Daula; symbol of Lucknow.

nearest_airport: Chaudhary Charan Singh International Airport (approx. 20–22 km)
accessibility: Inner areas have stairs and carpets; partial access externally
guided_tours: Guides available locally
parking: Nearby parking and rickshaw access
special_notes: Known for ornate interiors and chandeliers.

entry_fee: No general entry fee; special services may have fees
accessibility: Temple lanes are older and narrow; mobility challenging in crowds
guided_tours: Local guides and priest-led explanations available
parking: Near main temple complexes parking available but limited
special_notes: Birthplace of Lord Krishna; heavy pilgrim traffic during Janmashtami & Holi.

timings: Temples follow multiple darshan / aarti timings
entry_fee: No general entry fee; donations customary
accessibility: Narrow lanes and crowded temple premises; limited wheelchair access
guided_tours: Local guides & pilgrim tour operators
parking: Local paid parking near main temple clusters
nearby_amenities: Guesthouses, eateries serving satvik food, shops
special_notes: Krishna devotional hub with many temples & festivals (Holi, Janmashtami).

entry_fee: No general entry fee; special services may have charges
accessibility: New infrastructure improved access; central complex has stepped areas
guided_tours: Local guides available; many pilgrimage packages include guides
parking: Designated parking zones & e-rickshaws within city
special_notes: Site considered the birthplace of Lord Rama; major development upgrades.

timings: Accessible round the clock; specific ghat activities vary
entry_fee: No general entry fee; boat rides chargeable
accessibility: Ghats have steps; wheelchairs difficult in some areas
guided_tours: Local guides / priests available; tour operators
parking: Nearby paid parking in city approaches
special_notes: Site of historic Magh Mela / Kumbh gatherings; huge pilgrim footfall.

entry_fee: Temple complex: generally free; museum may have fees
accessibility: Well-developed Buddhist circuit with paved approaches; moderate accessibility
guided_tours: International pilgrims common; guides available in many languages
parking: Parking available near monasteries and museum
special_notes: Believed to be where Buddha attained Mahaparinirvana.

category: Wildlife Sanctuary / National Park / Tiger Reserve
nearest_bus: Palia Kalan bus connectivity (approx. local distances)
accessibility: Road access; safari zones require moderate walking sometimes
guided_tours: Forest department guides and jeep safaris available
parking: Parking available at designated entry points
nearby_amenities: Eco-resorts, lodges, basic shops and eateries
special_notes: Home to tigers, rhinos and rich biodiversity; Vistadome train safari introduced.

entry_fee: No general entry fee; some sites/temples may have donations
accessibility: Hilly terrain in spots; many temples require walking; partial accessibility
guided_tours: Local guides available; pilgrimage tour packages common
parking: Available in town and near main temples
nearby_amenities: Guesthouses, eateries, shops for religious items
special_notes: Important in Ramayana tradition — many temples, ghats and caves.

accessibility: Fort involves climbing; not wheelchair-friendly
guided_tours: Local guides available
parking: Parking near approaches
special_notes: Associated with Rani Lakshmibai and 1857 rebellion.

timings: Temples and ghats open morning to evening
nearest_bus: Kanpur bus stands & Bithoor local buses (approx. 20–25 km)
accessibility: Small town, boat/ghat areas; moderate walking
guided_tours: Local guides available
parking: Limited; use Kanpur as base
special_notes: Associated with Indian freedom history and Ramayana references.

timings: Temple opening hours typical for Hindu temples
accessibility: Hill approaches, steps to temple; moderate difficulty
guided_tours: Local guides available; pilgrimage packages offered
parking: Available at approaches and parking lots
special_notes: Famous for Navratri pilgrimage & Vindhyavasini worship.

place_name: Bara & Chota Sthambh / Historical sites in Bundelkhand
accessibility: Some climbing and uneven terrain; partial accessibility
guided_tours: Local guides and heritage walk operators
parking: Public parking near the entrance
nearby_amenities: Heritage hotels, riverfront eateries, local markets
special_notes: Orchha palace complex is a Bundelkhand highlight.

nearest_airport: Chaudhary Charan Singh International Airport (approx. 20–25 km)
accessibility: Ruined structures with pathways; variable accessibility
guided_tours: Heritage guides available
parking: Nearby paid parking
special_notes: Important 1857 rebel history site.
